title: I have an Aurora7 from Alienware with Windows10. I keep having a lagspike/freezing problem.
body:
Whenever i play League i always have this Lagging/Freezing issue, my champion starts running to my last clicked position and just stands there for about three seconds and everything freezes. After the 3 sec's my computer makes this sound like i just plugged in an external device (even though i didn't) and i can move again. Its like i just lose 3 or 4 sec's of in game time a few times a game. I am new to owning a computer so i'm not sure what the problem is or how i can fix it. I have good wired connection, I've tried turning off my bluetooth to fix it, but a NO GO.
Anyone else have this problem before? If not anyone got any ideas?

replies.body: This sounds an awful lot like packet loss to me, which can be pretty easy to pinpoint but sometimes rather hard to fix if it's happening before your connection reaches our servers. We can run a traceroute to the NA servers at 104.160.131.1 using something like [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and post the results here for me to take a look for you!

You could take a look at event log and see if there are any hardware events for devices attaching/detaching or being disabled for some unknown reason. This could be a problem with drivers or even the motherboard. If you have any usb devices besides your mouse plugged in, it is also worth trying to play with them unplugged to isolate the problem and see if that fixes anything. Good luck!
